basics.name: Samantha Kocher
basics.label: Recent Graduate
basics.summary: I am a recent graduate of a B.S. in Computer Science - Security Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences, with a Minor in Japanese from the Japanesee Language in the East Asian Languages and Literatures at the University of Hawaii. I am hoping to gain experience in any technical field, but aim to eventually build a career as a Cybersecurity Analyst.

courses: ICS 111: Introduction to Computer Science I
ICS 211: Introduction to Computer Science II
ICS 222: Basic Concepts of Computer Science
ECE 491B: Special Topics in EE: Artificial Intelligence

work.summary: Assist and support day-to-day IT operations within the University of Hawaii Cancer Center.
highlights: Provide Tier 1 & Tier 2 technical support for Windows, macOS, and Linux environments
Assist in the configuration and maintenance of institutional devices including endpoint security tools and antivirus software
Support asset management and inventory audits for compliance and IT policy adherence
Respond to phishing attempts and suspicious activity reports following internal escalation procedures
Help test and document IT infrastructure and security protocols, including access permissions and backups.

work.summary: Helped maintain reports needed for businesses for the CEO.
highlights: Input invoices into P&L's and Quickbooks.
Input new hire employee's into ADP.
Maintain and organize filing systems both online and in the office.
Created procedures and systems to teach new hire's more efficiently.
Worked closely with Google applications and Microsoft Office when created reports.

work.summary: Worked retail as a sales representative.
highlights: Assist customers with their needs and help find outfits to fit their desires.
Work the cash register quickly and efficiently.
Kept track of the reps and times of each contestant to determine who places where.
Worked in groups of about 5 to determine who is assigned to what category and/or task.

certificates.title: Good Clinical Practice Course for Clinical Trials Involving Drugs
University of Hawaii Information Security Awareness Training (ISAT)
